name: Pbc fix
tagline: Fix problematic crossing of box boundaries in MD trajectories.
body:
### Welcome to pbc_fix!
This little Python utility corrects Molecular Dynamics trajectories in which the system simulated deforms and expands beyond the dimensions of the simulation box. At present it only works for rectangular simulation boxes.

If you find it useful please cite it:

[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/4607/jhelie/pbc_fix.svg)](http://dx.doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16524)

### Usage

```
$ python pbc_fix.py -f file.gro -x file.xtc
$ python pbc_fix.py --help
```

### Example

Frame extracted from raw trajectory containing about 50,000 lipids and 500 peptides:

![Raw data](https://github.com/jhelie/pbc_fix/blob/master/pbc_before.png?raw=true)

Same frame extracted from processed trajectory:

![After processing](https://github.com/jhelie/pbc_fix/blob/master/pbc_after.png?raw=true)
